ac_dimmer.docs:
This component has not been fully tested yet, if you are testing this component please share your experience with the dimmer hardware and light model and configuration here [https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests/issues/278](https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests/issues/278)

*See also: [AC Dimmer Component](https://esphome.io/components/output/ac_dimmer.html#ac-dimmer-component)*

ble_client.docs:
The `ble_client` component is a output that can write a binary value to service characteristics of BLE devices.

*See also: [BLE Client Binary Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ble_client.html#ble-client-binary-output)*

bp1658cj.docs:
The BP1658CJ output component exposes a BP1658CJ channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/bp1658cj.html#bp1658cj-component) as a float output.

*See also: [bp1658cj Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/bp1658cj.html#output)*

bp5758d.docs:
The BP5758D output component exposes a BP5758D channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/bp5758d.html#bp5758d-component) as a float output.

*See also: [bp5758d Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/bp5758d.html#output)*

custom.docs:
This integration can be used to create custom binary and float [outputs](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html) in ESPHome using the C++ (Arduino) API.

*See also: [Custom Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/custom.html#custom-output)*

dac7678.docs:
The DAC7678 output component exposes a DAC7678 DAC channel of a global [DAC7678 hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/dac7678.html#dac7678-component) as a float output.

*See also: [DAC7678 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/dac7678.html#dac7678-output)*

esp32_dac.docs:
The ESP32 DAC platform allows you to output analog voltages using the 8-bit digital-to-analog converter of the ESP32. Unlike the [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html), which can simulate an analog signal by using a fast switching frequency, the hardware DAC can output a *real* analog signal with no need for additional filtering.

*See also: [ESP32 DAC](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp32_dac.html#esp32-dac)*

esp8266_pwm.docs:
The ESP8266 Software PWM platform allows you to use a software PWM on the pins GPIO0-GPIO16 on your ESP8266. Note that this is a software PWM, so there can be some flickering during periods of high WiFi activity. Hardware PWMs like the one on the ESP32 (see [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html)) are preferred.

*See also: [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html#esp8266-software-pwm-output)*

gpio.docs:
The GPIO output component is quite simple: It exposes a single GPIO pin as an output component. Note that output components are **not** switches and will not show up in Home Assistant. See [GPIO Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/gpio.html).

*See also: [GPIO Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/gpio.html#gpio-output)*

ledc.docs:
The LEDC output component exposes a [LEDC PWM channel](https://docs.espressif.com/projects/esp-idf/en/latest/api-reference/peripherals/ledc.html) of the ESP32 as an output component.

*See also: [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html#esp32-ledc-output)*

libretiny_pwm.docs:
The LibreTiny PWM platform allows you to use a hardware PWM on BK72xx and RTL87xx chips. Refer to [LibreTiny/Boards](https://docs.libretiny.eu/link/boards) to find your board and which PWM pins it supports.

*See also: [LibreTiny PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/libretiny_pwm.html#libretiny-pwm-output)*

mcp4725.docs:
The MCP4725 output component allows to use [12bit external DAC](https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/mcp4725-digital-to-analog-converter-hookup-guide/all) in order to have analog output(s) on any board by using I2C. Devices default address is `0x60` and configurable alternative is `0x61`.

*See also: [MCP4725 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/mcp4725.html#mcp4725-output)*

mcp4728.docs:
The MCP4728 output component exposes 4 MCP4728 channels of a global [MCP4728](https://esphome.io/components/output/mcp4728.html#id1) as float outputs.

*See also: [MCP4728 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/mcp4728.html#mcp4728-output)*

mcp47a1.docs:
The `mcp47a1` output component allows to use [6bit external DAC](https://www.microchip.com/en-us/product/MCP47A1) in order to have analog output(s) on any board by using I²C. Devices default address is `0x2E` and configurable alternative is `0x3E`.

*See also: [MCP47A1 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/mcp47a1.html#mcp47a1-output)*

modbus_controller.docs:
The `modbus_controller` platform creates a output from a modbus_controller.

*See also: [Modbus Controller Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/modbus_controller.html#modbus-controller-output)*

my9231.docs:
The MY931/MY9291 output component exposes a MY931/MY9291 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#my9231-component) as a float output.

*See also: [my9231 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/my9231.html#output)*

pca9685.docs:
The PCA9685 output component exposes a PCA9685 PWM channel of a global [PCA9685 hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/pca9685.html#pca9685-component) as a float output.

*See also: [PCA9685 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/pca9685.html#pca9685-output)*

pipsolar.docs:
Not all possible outputs are exposed as they lead to the possibility to make serious damage. They should only be set at the physical device itself.

*See also: [pipsolar Output](https://esphome.io/components/pipsolar.html#output)*

sigma_delta_output.docs:
This integration uses [sigma-delta modulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delta-sigma_modulation) to output a floating-point value on a binary output. Unlike with [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html), it is possible to update the output value with each update cycle, not just at the end of a longer period.

*See also: [Sigma-Delta Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sigma_delta_output.html#sigma-delta-output)*

slow_pwm.docs:
Similar to PWM, the Slow PWM Output platform allows you to control GPIO pins by pulsing them on/off over a longer time period. It could be used to control a heating element through a relay where a fast PWM update cycle would not be appropriate.

*See also: [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html#slow-pwm-output)*

sm16716.docs:
The SM16716 output component exposes a SM16716 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#sm16716-component) as a float output.

*See also: [sm16716 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm16716.html#output)*

sm2135.docs:
The SM2135 output component exposes a SM2135 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#sm2135-component) as a float output.

*See also: [sm2135 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2135.html#output)*

sm2235.docs:
The SM2235 output component exposes a SM2235 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2235.html#sm2235-component) as a float output.

*See also: [sm2235 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2235.html#output)*

sm2335.docs:
The SM2335 output component exposes a SM2335 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2335.html#sm2335-component) as a float output.

*See also: [sm2335 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sm2335.html#output)*

template.docs:
The `template` output component can be used to create templated binary and float outputs in ESPHome.

*See also: [Template Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/template.html#template-output)*

tlc59208f.docs:
The TLC59208F output component exposes a TLC59208F PWM channel of a global [TLC59208F chip](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#tlc59208f-component) as a float output.

*See also: [TLC59208F Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc59208f.html#tlc59208f-output)*

tlc5947.docs:
The tlc5947 output component exposes a tlc5947 channel of a global [Component/Hub](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc5947.html#tlc5947-component) as a float output.

*See also: [tlc5947 Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/tlc5947.html#output)*

x9c.docs:
The `x9c` output platform allows you to add an output that controls a [X9C digital potentiometer](https://www.renesas.com/us/en/document/dst/x9c102-x9c103-x9c104-x9c503-datasheet).

*See also: [X9C Potentiometer Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/x9c.html#x9c-potentiometer-output)*

power_supply.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The [power supply](https://esphome.io/components/power_supply.html) to connect to this output. When the output is enabled, the power supply will automatically be switched on too.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

inverted.docs:
**boolean**: If the output should be treated as inverted. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

max_power.docs:
**float**: Sets the maximum output value of this output platform. Must be in range from min_power to 1. Defaults to `1`.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

min_power.docs:
**float**: Sets the minimum output value of this output platform. Must be in range from 0 to max_power. Defaults to `0`.  If zero_means_zero is `false` this will be output value when the entity is turned off.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

zero_means_zero.docs:
**boolean**: Sets the output to use actual 0 instead of `min_power`. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The id to use for this output component.

*See also: [Base Output Configuration](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#base-output-configuration)*

turn_on.docs:
This action turns the output with the given ID on when executed.

*See also: [`output.turn_on` Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-turn-on-action)*

turn_off.docs:
This action turns the output with the given ID off when executed.

*See also: [`output.turn_off` Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-turn-off-action)*

set_level.docs:
This action sets the float output to the given level when executed. Note: This only works with floating point outputs like [ESP8266 Software PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/esp8266_pwm.html), [ESP32 LEDC Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/ledc.html), [Sigma-Delta Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/sigma_delta_output.html), [Slow PWM Output](https://esphome.io/components/output/slow_pwm.html).

*See also: [`output.set_level` Action](https://esphome.io/components/output/index.html#output-set-level-action)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [Generic Output Button](https://esphome.io/components/button/output.html#configuration-variables)*

output.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the output component to use.

*See also: [Generic Output Button](https://esphome.io/components/button/output.html#configuration-variables)*

duration.docs:
**[Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: How long the output should be set when the button is pressed.

*See also: [Generic Output Button](https://esphome.io/components/button/output.html#configuration-variables)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [Generic Output Lock](https://esphome.io/components/lock/output.html#configuration-variables)*

output.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the output component to use.

*See also: [Generic Output Lock](https://esphome.io/components/lock/output.html#configuration-variables)*

id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [Generic Output Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/output.html#configuration-variables)*

output.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the output component to use.

*See also: [Generic Output Switch](https://esphome.io/components/switch/output.html#configuration-variables)*
